title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2014 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)
description: This bright, lemony wine is lightly mineral as well as fruity. A crisp apple character gains even more tightness from a shot of lime juice. The wine is ready to drink, light and refreshing with a buttery aftertaste.

title: Eco Terreno 2015 Cuvée Acero Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Some of the grapes for this unoaked white come from old vines, as well as some from the Musque clone, making for a tart, linear taste of lemon verbena and sizzling acidity that's somewhat overshadowed by the unctuous texture and full body.

title: Magistrate 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is soft and light-bodied. It's not overly complex, but is nicely put together to share characteristics of dried herb, sage and red currant.

title: Manciat-Poncet 2014 Les Chênes  (Mâcon-Charnay)
description: This wine offers spice and ripe apple and pear flavors. A tangy, almost peppery character suggests ginger as well as toastiness. The minerality is prominent, with a tight, nervy character. Drink from 2017.

title: Manos Negras 2014 Red Soil Select Pinot Noir (Neuquén)
description: Muddled berry aromas are earthy. This feels grabby, full and rubbery. Flavors of baked berry, chocolate and toast precede a dry, roasted finish that's chunky in weight and ends with a good deal of earthy spice.

title: McPherson 2014 Reserve Roussanne (Texas High Plains)
description: Restrained on the nose, this varietal wine brings muddled lemon with a slight char and salty cheese rind to mind. There's a substantial weight to the palate, as well as a bit more fruit, with bruised peach offering a bit of juiciness. Silken in feel, there's just enough acid to maintain balance.

title: Moscone 2011 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of toast, espresso, weedy underbrush and scorched soil lead the nose. The evolved palate offers cured meat, licorice, exotic spice and a note recalling cherry marinated in spirits but the fruit is already drying up. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol while astringent tannins grip the finish.

title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Round and smooth, this rich wine has the right acidity for the ripe pear, green plum and thrust of citrus. A backbone of minerality gives structure, while a spicy nutmeg note complements the subtle nutty character. Drink now.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Vinified in new 500-liter oak barrels, this wine is fresh, fruity and crisp. It has attractive acidity, a strong streak of minerality and lively lemon fruit. With a taut, nervy edge, the wine has a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Josetta Saffirio 2012  Barolo
description: Dark berry, toasted hazelnut and menthol aromas lift out of the glass. The tightly wound palate is still rather closed and on the lean side in terms of fruit richness, but slowly reveals sour cherry, licorice and a note of ground pepper. A tannic backbone provides structure.

title: Glaser 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Southern Oregon)
description: This is a dark, slightly sweet expression of Cabernet, that pushes the alcohol and oak (in this case, American oak) components to the limits. At the center are ripe blackberry and cassis flavors. Overall the impression is a chunky, one-dimensional, but quite flavorful wine.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Lois White (Alentejano)
description: A lemon flavored wine that is soft and fruity. With its zesty, tight texture and really crisp acidity, the wine is lively and crisp. Drinkable now, it will be better from early 2017.

title: Jack's House 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: An aroma like fresh-baked bread and flavors like tart apple and nutmeg mean this medium-bodied wine is subtle in a good way, and has a bright mouth-feel. The Jack on the label is golfer Nicklaus, for whom this wine was bottled.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2014 Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)
description: Hints of smoked nuts and vanilla spice lend dimension to this soft supple cherry bomb. Semisweet and low in alcohol, it's a dependable porch sipper with a subtle edge of savoriness.

title: Pasaeli 2014 6N Red (Aegean)
description: Deep cherry-red in the glass, this wine proffers a bouquet of strawberry, coffee bean and anise. It is very bright for a red wine and a touch tart, with flavors of cranberry, eucalyptus and mocha. Almost imperceptible tannins linger through the zesty finish.

title: Pasaeli 2015 Seahorse Rosé Çalkarası (Aegean)
description: Apricot blush in color, this wine has aromas of tangerine and strawberry. Flavors of tangerine, orange blossom and grapefruit persist into the bright finish.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014  Bourgogne
description: Soft red fruits dominate this only lightly structured wine. It is more about juicy Pinot Noir, fruity with raspberry and red-currant flavors. Dryness at the core of the wine adds shape. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Raineri Gianmatteo 2012  Barolo
description: This opens with aromas of French oak, toast, menthol and coconut while the lean palate offers mint and a hint of dark spice. It lacks fruit richness while bracing tannins grip the finish.

title: Raylee 2014 Syn Red (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: This sturdy, homespun red blend of 65% Syrah, 20% Zinfandel and 15% Cabernet Sauvignon pushes spicy cherry flavors ahead of earthy tannins set on a bed of rock. It's a fine, all-purpose barbeque red.

title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Azal (Vinho Verde)
description: Azal is one of most widely planted vines in Vinho Verde. It gives an attractive wine, with high acidity. This wine is crisp with lemon and with a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Nadine et Maurice Guerrin 2014 Sur la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Crisp with bright citrus fruits, this is a mineral-textured wine with tight acidity and a edgy character. The aftertaste is bright and zesty. Drink now.

title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)
description: Though the vineyard sits at 1,100 feet, hints of tropical fruits give this wine a ripe feel. Pineapple and mango mingle with crisper citrus flavors, yielding a wine that is both fresh and ripe. Drink now.

title: Poças 2015 Poças White (Douro)
description: With a high percentage of Malvasia in the blend, the wine has an attractive floral character that softens and fills out the mineral texture. It is crisp while ripe, finishing with vibrant acidity. Drink now.

title: Verum 2015 Chardonnay (Alto Valle del Río Negro)
description: Oily citrus aromas are round and briny. This feels front-loaded, meaning there isn't much depth to the palate. Short, lightly stalky apple and citrus flavors turn pithy on the finish.

title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)
description: This soft wine features attractive citrus and creamed-apple flavors. It is round, full, lightly spicy and presents an easy, immediately drinkable character.

title: Vila Nova 2015 White (Vinho Verde)
description: With its light prickle on the tongue and mineral texture, this is a crisp, dry wine. It is floral with pineapple and bright apple flavors. The acidity and the tangy orange zest all add to the freshness of the wine. Drink now.

title: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)
description: While jasmine and tropical fruit aromas show nice concentration on the nose, there's a bit of a chemical undertone. The weighty palate in punchy in character, with Juicy Fruit gum, banana and canned peach flavors.

title: Negro Giuseppe 2013 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: Intense rose, iris and aromatic herb aromas are the highlight of this wine. The palate isn't as expressive, offering raw sour cherry, powdered sage and excruciatingly astringent tannins that dry out the mouth. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak.

title: One Leaf 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: The wine smells and tastes like fresh, crisp pippin apples, has a lively, refreshing texture and soothing fruity aftertaste.

title: Henry Estate 2015 Müller-Thurgau (Umpqua Valley)
description: This intentionally spritzy wine is crafted for immediate drinking. The fruit flavors fall under the heading generic white wine. Best enjoyed chilled, perhaps with toasted almonds or a soft cheese.
